Engineering Corpus:
Stella Adams: Hi, thanks for calling QMG. This is Stella, how may I help?
Client: Hi, I'm trying to find into the patient portal to pay a bill that I think I owe, but I'm having trouble because I don't know my username or password. I don't think I've ever done this before. Or is it something I could pay over the phone if I...
Stella Adams: Ma'am, I would like to know the name of the doctor's office, which is actually mentioned in the top left corner of the bill.
Client: Yeah, Carrie Rutt.
Stella Adams: Note the name of the doctor at the doctor's office. Can you see that on the top left corner, please?
Client: Prine Health.
Stella Adams: Prine Health, okay. Yeah, that's the name of the office. Are you the patient there, ma'am?
Client: Yes.
Stella Adams: Can you please provide me your account number for the office?
Client: 257668. 257668.
Stella Adams: And may I have your full name and your date of birth for the verification purposes?
Client: Andrea Papianakis, date of birth is 12-14-82.
Stella Adams: Okay, what I can see here that the bill you have received is for $20. You would like to make a payment for that? Okay, can you please provide me your card number?
Client: Okay. 42666701375.
Stella Adams: 42666701...
Client: No, sorry, sorry, I messed up. First four digits, because I was looking at another card. Sorry, first four digits is four, and then the rest should be right. 46670179272375.
Stella Adams: Okay, so it's 4207670179272375.
Client: Yeah.
Stella Adams: May I have the card expiration? 727. 727. And may I have the security code? 347. 347. And do you allow me to charge $20 from this account?
Client: Yes.
Stella Adams: Okay, ma'am, just a second please. Do you want the authorization code?
Client: Like a confirmation?
Stella Adams: Oh, you mean to my phone?
Client: Yeah.
Stella Adams: I will provide you a confirmation number that the payment has been made.
Client: Okay.
Stella Adams: So, Andrea, there are 000000000.
Client: That's the, oh, okay, that's the confirmation. So three triple zeros?
Stella Adams: Yes, nine zeros. Then, 4009.
Client: 1409, okay, $40, right?
Stella Adams: Yeah, 409.
Client: Okay.
Stella Adams: It has been made. So, is there anything else, members, I just said?
Client: No, P20 via phone, I'm just making notes here. And today is 918, and your name? Stella.
Stella Adams: Stella, okay. Yep.
Client: Cool, all right, great, thank you.
Stella Adams: Thank you, ma'am, have a great day, goodbye.
Client: All right, you too, bye.

Engineering Corpus:
Emma Grant: Thank you for calling QMD. This is Emma. How can I help? Hola espa単ol. Sorry? Hola espa単ol. Oh, sorry. We can speak English only. Okay, okay. Just a minute. Hello? Hello. Hi. How can I help you?
Client: I got a bill for $572, and we wanted to know how come we got the bill when my VAP insurance should cover everything.
Emma Grant: I would like to know who has sent you the bill, ma'am. It should be mentioned in the top left corner of the bill.
Client: Oh, yes. It says Long and Harris Dematologist.
Emma Grant: Okay, and the account number. Do they have it? I have the account number. It's 44432. It's 44432. Yes, ma'am. Thank you. Please confirm patient's name. Octavio Ramos. Your relation with the patient, ma'am? I'm his daughter. Okay. And the bill is for $572.95? Yes, ma'am. Well, I believe this balance has been transferred to you by the Insurance United Healthcare.
Client: He had this appointment back in, I think, February.
Emma Grant: He had insurance that cost a month, I believe.
Client: They let him know that they won't be covering all appointments now. So we just wanted to know why it happened now.
Emma Grant: I'm checking. Well, I will suggest you to check with the Insurance United Healthcare because from our end claim has been submitted to United Healthcare and your insurance has paid $1,031.71 and remaining balance for $572.95 has been transferred as a patient's responsibility. So there were some issues going with the insurance and I will suggest you to check with insurance first because maybe they are able to tell you like why they have transferred a balance of $572 as a co-insurance.
Client: All right. Perfect. Thank you so much.
Emma Grant: You're welcome. And then after talking with insurance, if needed, you can call us back.
Client: Perfect. All right.
Emma Grant: All right. Thank you for calling. Have a good one. Bye-bye.
Client: You too. Bye.

Engineering Corpus:
Barry Walker: Thank you for calling Dr. Kalani's office.
Client: My name is Barry.
Barry Walker: How may I help you?
Client: Thank you to my insurance company for the past need, the diagnostic codes, and the, I think it was the employee identification number. I mean, I'm just bringing up the list. We can itemize bill. I got the receipt, the credit card receipt, but I need like an actual kind of statement.
Barry Walker: Give me one second. What is your date of birth now?
Client: 6-2-83.
Barry Walker: So you see Dr. Bob Kalani, right? Yes. Okay, and give me one second.
Client: Sure.
Barry Walker: So you no longer have UnitedHealthcare? No, I do, but, so we extended our insurance through COBRA
Client: and there was like a 10-day delay where UnitedHealthcare didn't update their system. So because it was taking long and your office wasn't able to submit the claim, on my last session, Dr. Kalani said, you're gonna just charge me the full, which is fine. And also I'm gonna submit, you know, my, me.
Barry Walker: But in order to do that, I need like the diagnosis
Client: and, you know, procedure codes and all that information. Otherwise they won't reimburse me.
Barry Walker: Ma'am, if I am to say that we can submit the claim on your behalf, would that be okay?
Client: $400 though.
Barry Walker: Let me just quickly check on that.
Client: Okay, yeah, I already paid for Kalani, so I think I need to submit the claim, unless you wanna refund me that money.
Barry Walker: Let me just quickly check one little thing.
Client: Okay, thanks. It seems that the insurance has backdated
Barry Walker: and now your insurance seems to be active on 9-12 and you had your first visit.
Client: Yeah.
Barry Walker: Okay, so I believe you have both options right now. So if you were to submit the claims yourself,
Client: do you, what else do you need
Barry Walker: other than the diagnosis codes?
Client: So I need the, Dr. Kalani's tax ID number and then, yeah, you know, like a proper statement, you know, from your office, like an itemized bill.
Barry Walker: And you mentioned that you've already received the receipt?
Client: Yeah, I have the credit card receipt. It came through the payment hub service. It doesn't have any of the other info I need.
Barry Walker: Okay, so here's what I'll send you. I'll send you an itemized bill. It will have the procedure codes for both data services and also the payment amount and the diagnosis code and Dr. Bob's tax ID.
Client: Perfect, I think that's everything I need. Great, thanks so much.
Barry Walker: So I'll send a message, sorry about that. So I'll send a message to Dr. Kalani first.
Client: As soon as I have the approval,
Barry Walker: I'll send you the receipt within 30 minutes of that.
Client: Okay, thank you so much. I really appreciate it.
Barry Walker: Have a wonderful day.
Client: Thank you, bye bye.

Todd Francis: Thank you for calling, this is Chad, how can I help?

Troy Mason: Thank you so much for contacting CureMD. This is Troy. How can I help you?
Client: Hi Troy, this is Premier Psychiatry. Do you guys have any complaints about CureMD? Lagging, kicking people off?
Troy Mason: Well, so far no. Are you facing any trouble? This has been happening since last week. And last week when we called, they said that we were not the only people calling. They've received multiple calls. So this has been happening to us since last week. And we need to figure out what is going on. Okay. Would you be able to explain what is really happening?
Client: Sure. When we go to, like, just now I was going into the schedule and the patient said his date of birth is wrong. I said, I can fix that for you, sir. I went to registration, clicked on the date of birth and it's just spinning, spinning, spinning, spinning. And then it says, aw snap, something went wrong. So it says, would you like to wait or would you like to log off and go back in? So we log off and we log back in and we do this all day long, every day. And it's crazy. We see hundreds of patients a day. I understand that this was just a fluke and it was only happening for one day. But it's been since last week now. And it's not just me. Like, now it's the other providers, it's the girls in the front, it's the gentleman in the front complaining.
Troy Mason: He keeps getting kicked off. We got patients sitting on the phone.
Client: We're like, hold on one moment please. And it's just spinning. So you have to keep the patient holding while you log off, log back in, and then it seems to work fine for a few minutes. And then it happens again.
Troy Mason: All right.
Client: And if it's an issue with CureMD, we can't be the only one complaining about it. And we have people that work overseas, we have remote operators and they're experiencing the same thing. So it's not our internet because they said it's been happening Thursday, Friday and today. It's really bad. They're only able to answer half the calls that they would normally answer because it's very, very slow. And when it does, it just keeps spinning and you have to log out, log back in, and then you have to write the information down so you don't have to keep the patient holding.
Troy Mason: And it's happening with all of the users of the practice, not just one, right?
Client: Everyone. Everyone. Yep.
Troy Mason: I see. You know what? Let me check because previously Colin Nelson has worked with that. Let me check with Colin and see what we can do about this.
Client: Thank you so much.
Troy Mason: No problem.
Client: Thank you.
Troy Mason: Stay connected.
Client: Do you want to just call me back?
Troy Mason: If you can just stay connected.
Client: That's fine.
Troy Mason: It's just going to take a minute.
Client: Yeah, sure. Thank you. Sure. For now, just keep logging out and log back in when you get the messages, you guys. Log out. Just hit the X. Write what you need down. Hit the X and go back in.
Troy Mason: Thank you so much for your patience.
Client: Thank you.
Troy Mason: All right. So actually we have someone from the IT team available who can look into this.
Client: Okay.
Troy Mason: They should be able to resolve this.
Client: Thanks.
Troy Mason: He's very good. It's Neil Banks.
Client: Thank you.
Troy Mason: And he will just need to do any disk and see the behavior.
Client: Okay. I'm ready. Do you want the number?
Troy Mason: So I'm going to transfer you to Neil right now and you can give him the details.
Client: Okay.
Troy Mason: All right. Thank you.
Client: Hi Neil. You know, this is Peggy from Premier Psychiatry, but I said, of course you're going to do it on any desk and now it's going to work fine. This has been happening since last week Thursday. I can't believe you guys aren't getting bombarded with calls. It cannot just be our practice.
Troy Mason: Yeah. At the moment we haven't received like any sort of call in regards to snow and anything like that in the whole day of today, you know.
Client: Yeah. Because it was happening last week and last week they said yes, they were getting some other calls with the same complaint so that the IT team was working on it. So I was like, okay, no big deal. Just, you know, hopefully it'll get resolved, which was fine. But now that we're done with the weekend, we're here on a Monday and it keeps happening. But now I'm trying to go through the schedule and get it to happen for me. And it's not, of course. I wish you guys could just remote in and watch it for a while, but it's not going to happen. Okay. Peggy, one thing would really, yeah, one thing would really help us out, you know, like if like you could like whenever that happens, if you could like record that. We did it last week. You guys were on an any desk and you recorded it and he said he was going to escalate it to the IT team and they were going to get it resolved. I think it was Henry, I think. Jonathan or Henry. It's happening. Okay. Get a 301. Yeah. 725-050.
Troy Mason: Okay, kindly put everything in the answer and you get a request. You're in? Yeah, I can see the screen. Okay. Yeah. And that's what's happening.
Client: And all I did was go to the calendar, hit edit to see if the patient showed a balance or not right there. But then you get this wheel. It happens about every I'd say you get to do like maybe five to seven tasks and then boom, this is going to happen. And then you have two options. You shut it down, go back in again, then you have another 10 minutes before it happens again. So and we have operators overseas too that do remote. They work remotely for us and it's happening to them too. They said they're not having any problems with any of the other programs, only care MD. And it's been since Thursday last week. I wish it would be horrible how it seems to be going okay for you. And then you get that message that says, oh snap, something went wrong. So you have no choice but to log out, log back in. Do you have any care MD issues? I have a patient. He's looking and that's care MD on my computer. They're looking into fixing it now. What's the question? The patient and I don't know. The patient is 68 and she has to care for the brother's elderly wife or handicapped wife. Okay. So she has an option then. She does have an out. Go back to Virginia. She has no friends in Virginia. Troy Mason: That's not anything we get for her sister-in-law. And now she is the only one who can get her out of it. Okay. So Peggy, that blank care MD notification that pops up at the start of the call.
Client: I'm so sorry. What did you say?
Troy Mason: Yeah. Like when you face like a slow prompt shows up like that blank care MD prompt that we faced at the start of the call.
Client: Okay.
Troy Mason: Other than that?
Client: Well, yeah, you'll get the error, but it's not happening right now. It'll say, aw, snap, something went wrong. Log out and log back in. But it's not happening. I can't get it to happen. Now this is delayed, but not that bad. At least it's working. Now it's just a little slightly delayed, but it's not like it was. No, it's working now. I guess the next time it happens, I could do screenshots for you. That's the best I can do, but they did record it last week.
Troy Mason: And he said, oh, I will, I'll escalate this to the IT team. Okay. No worries. Kindly bear with me just a minute.
Client: You know, honey, I can't, I have a provider standing here and he's upset and his patient is crying. So I have to take care of this. I got to take care of the patient. I'm sorry. I'll see what I can do. If it happens again, I'll try to get you back on any desk.

Jordan Moore: Thank you for calling CDI and this is Jordan. How can I help?
Client: Yes, I'm a patient. I just wonder how come I didn't get a billing? That's why I'm calling you to find out.
Jordan Moore: Can I get your account number?
Client: I don't have any bill in front of me. That's what I'm calling about.
Jordan Moore: Okay, it's okay. Can I get your date of birth then?
Client: November 5, 1949.
Jordan Moore: All right, bear with me please. And your name please.
Client: Susan. Last name's OU.
Jordan Moore: You said November the 5th of 1945?
Client: Yes, 49.
Jordan Moore: 49, I'm sorry. Okay, we have not sent you the bill yet. Let me check. Why didn't you get it? Just bear with me. I'm checking the records of the statements. Why were you not being sent? Would you mind if I put you in a little hold? I'll be just back. Okay.
Client: Thank you so much. I'll be back.
Jordan Moore: Thank you for staying online. Ma'am, are you there?
Client: Yes.
Jordan Moore: Okay, it's showing me a balance of $97.10 on this account. I can request the team to send you the statement of it. And if you want to pay it, you can call the office to make a payment.
Client: Do you usually send out the bill to the patient's home address first?
Jordan Moore: Yes, I can get it sent to you over your mailing address.
Client: I want to verify it's updated. Sure. The mailing address.
Jordan Moore: Okay, the one we have here is 2838 Winslow Springs Drive, Anderson, Nevada. And the zip is 89052.
Client: That's correct, 2838, yes.
Jordan Moore: Perfect. I will request the team to send you the statement and then you can pay it.
Client: You will. That's telling me what's not covered, what's covered.
Jordan Moore: Yes, that's correct.
Client: Okay. After I receive it, how do I make a payment?
Jordan Moore: You can either write a check to the doctor's office, the address mentioned on the bill, or else you can call the doctor's office directly and you can make a payment there.
Client: Oh, I can call the doctor's office. But it's hard to reach them directly, right?
Jordan Moore: No, you can just redial the number you just dialed calling us. And after dialing the number, just press 1 and it will route you to the doctor's office.
Client: That's for scheduling. Your dial 1 is for scheduling.
Jordan Moore: That's correct. And the scheduling team is at the front desk and they take the payments at the front desk as well.
Client: Scheduling. I thought you have the doctor's fiscal address to pay, no?
Jordan Moore: No, you can. When you receive the statement, the address of the check to be sent will be written there on the statement.
Client: I don't send out a check. I will pay by credit card. Where do I pay?
Jordan Moore: You can either visit the office directly or else you can just call the number written on the bill and press 1 for the number which is for scheduling. You can just call them and you can tell them that you need to pay. It will be paid there over the phone.
Client: So your billing office doesn't take a payment over the phone?
Jordan Moore: The office does take the payments.
Client: No, your billing office. I'm calling you. You are the billing office. You don't take a payment.
Jordan Moore: Yes, I'm afraid we don't take it. It's the doctor's office who takes it.
Client: Oh, you are the third party. You are not there.
Jordan Moore: That's correct.
Client: Okay, got it. Thank you. Bye bye.
Jordan Moore: You're welcome. Have a good one. Bye bye.

On Saturday, I received a statement dated 9-7 including all the visits I already paid for plus one additional that I owe for. I've already paid for 4-24-5-19-16.

Client: 9-7 statement that my last paid amount was $110.92 that I paid. I hope I haven't paid duplicates for those two. These two bills came so together that...

Client: The number in the top left is the number I use to contact my doctor.
Dana Wilson: Yes, you have to contact on that number.
Client: Could I ask why I have to contact that number when I mailed this to you?
Dana Wilson: Which address do I have you mailed it to? Is that 1601 Bond Street?
Client: Yes.

Client: Okay. So, I call them and tell them that I talked to you.
Dana Wilson: Yes, they can cross check right away. You can just let them know that you have sent a payment.
Client: It's not posted into your account. You're receiving a statement.
Dana Wilson: They can cross check right away and they can make it posted into your account.
Client: Okay. Thank you very much.
Dana Wilson: You're welcome, Ms. Peterson.
Client: Thank you. Bye.
